activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Michael Philip Mainock

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:30 AM Defendant Bradley Michael Philip Mainock appeared by video.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Bradley Michael Philip Mainock.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders Defendant to sign bond by 4:30 PM on November 4, 2022. Matter scheduled with Branch 7.
Bail/bond hearing on November 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim KMS, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except by digital means for purposes of discussing child. No acts or threats of violence towards anyone.

1:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bradley Michael Philip Mainock appeared by video.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Bradley Michael Philip Mainock. Defendant address and date of birth verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions.  No contact directly or indirectly with victim KMS, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except by digital means for purposes of discussing child. No acts or threats of violence towards anyone. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set.
